content_text: A force is simply a push or a pull upon an object resulting from the object's interaction with another object. Whenever there is an interaction between two objects, there is a force upon each of the objects.
Watch this video to understand the basics of forces.
Inertia is the resistance of any physical object to any change in its velocity. This includes changes to the object's speed
Many students believe that a constant force is required to keep an object moving at a constant speed.
explanation: Newton's 1st Law states that an object in motion stays in motion with the same speed and in the same direction unless acted upon by an unbalanced force.
common_misconception: Force is needed to change motion (acceleration)
correction: not to maintain constant velocity (in the absence of friction).

content_text: When a car stops suddenly, passengers tend to keep moving forward due to inertia. Seatbelts provide the unbalanced force needed to stop the passenger safely.
